39981546.review:
This is my go-to game for throwing a pizza-beer-game day with friends. As a local multiplayer game, it always seduces everyone, of all genders and of all ages.

The game is very entertaining, immediately rewarding, easy to learn and very well balanced. Even in a match with a seasoned gamer, a complete newcomer and a young kid, there will be challenge for all of them. But unlike a game like Mario Kart, it doesn't feel like the game is hammering the strongest player, and rather that it is expecting more from them.

The price might feel a bit high for an indie, but in all honesty, given the fun we've had on this, I'd say it is well worth it.

39218186.review:
Una especie de side-scroller arena que recuerda mucho al estilo de juegos locales de hace unos años.

Los controles responden muy bien y son pocos, basicamente saltas, disparas y esquivas (que a la vez funciona para capturar las flechas enemigas)

Tiene suficiente contenido para mantenerte enganchado durante varias horas. Si querés sacar el 100% quizá te lleve un tiempo más debido a que algunos premios son bastante dificiles de conseguir sin varias horas de práctica previa.

La estética es medieval fantástica. Este es otro juego donde el arte y la música (y sonido) se apoyan muy bien y crean una atmósfera convincente. El compositor (Alec Holowka) utiliza recursos modales para darle a la música un estilo medieval mezclado con chiptune para vincular con la estética pixel art que presenta la gráfica, que por cierto, está cuidada al detalle.

Hay que decir que la parte más jugosa es el competitivo de 2 a 4 jugadores. Donde se pueden armar torneos personalizados y que son un caos muy divertido; y que en el cual más de uno se va a terminar calentando para el carajo. (vease divertido)

¿Me lo llevo?

+Especial para aquellos que les gustan los locales competitivos sin pantalla partida.
+Jugar esto de forma local con 3 amigos no tiene desperdicio. Las piñas y patadas están aseguradas.
+El arte y la banda sonora son lo más.
+Tiene un DLC el cual añade nuevos mapas y jefes + una campaña cooperativa + Workshop de Steam donde los jugadores pueden hacer sus propios mapas. ¿Qué tul?
+Si, compralo, está de 10.

39206415.review:
TowerFall Ascension is 2D platformer that looks simple on the surface, but look a little deeper and you'll find a fun campaign with tons of tricks and secrets.

The Good:
+Fun 2D platforming gameplay about shooting arrows. Great co-op campaign and fantastic local multiplayer.
+Great soundtrack!
+Pixel graphics are overused, but TowerFall Ascension is full of little details, like shooting the hat off players.

The Bad:
-Short campaign.
-Plays better with controllers, which means you mean at least 4 for parties.

Bottom Line:
TowerFall Ascension is a great game and even better at parties. There isn't much singleplayer content, but what there is will help hone your skills greatly.

37882389.review:
[h1]"A déguster seul ou entre amis"[/h1]

Ce jeu de combat en arène, publié d’abord sur la console « Ouya » puis sur PC en 2013 par [u]Matt Thorson[/u], va mettre à l’épreuve vos réflexes en vous confrontant au choix, à des bots impitoyables ou à vos propres amis (Tout aussi impitoyables) !

[b]Graphismes[/b]	Avec ses graphismes provenant tout droit des jeux vidéo rétro, TowerFall ascension en rendrait nostalgique plus d’un ! Toutefois il est aisé de se rendre compte que ce jeu est récent tant il est coloré et dynamique. Les menus évolutifs sont tous très originaux et détaillés malgré la contrainte des pixels, un aspect que l’on retrouve d’ailleurs dans l’ensemble des niveaux compris dans le jeu. Les décors sont répartis sur plusieurs Plans, ce qui donne malgré la 2D un aspect d’espace aux arènes. On ne peut que féliciter [u]Matt Thorson[/u] pour son souci du détail.
[h1]5/5[/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1214641087

[b]Ambiance sonore[/b]	La musique, réalisée par [u]Alec Holowka[/u], s’harmonise très bien avec le style graphique du jeu et est ,aux premières écoutes, très appréciable. En revanche, après quelques heures passées sur le jeu, on finit vite par se lasser de cette musique assez répétitive. Seule une variation de musique est disponible pour le menu principal et ne se débloque qu’à la fin (théorique) du jeu. Alors si vous avez pour ambition de terminer tous les trials en Diamants, pensez à ouvrir YouTube ou Spotify avant de lancer le jeu, au risque de très vite vous métamorphoser en Edmond Kemper.
[h1]3/5[/h1]

[b]Scénario[/b] 	Dans la mesure ou ce jeu est destiné à une utilisation « Arcade », il ne propose pas au joueur un scénario très palpitant. Malgré tout, le déverrouillage des niveaux et des différents personnages se fait progressivement et peut s’apparenter à une sorte d’histoire qui serait le fil conducteur du jeu. On notera également l’effort d’avoir agrémenté le jeu de quelques petites énigmes qui, même si elles ne sont pas bien compliquées, viennent éveiller votre curiosité.
[h1]5/5[/h1]

[b]Jouabilité[/b]	Avec jusqu’à 4 joueurs sur un même écran, confronter vous à vos amis en mode Versus ou bien tester votre skill en mode Coop face à des bots (2 joueurs max). Ce jeu met en place des mécaniques inédites avec ses bordures communicantes. De nombreuses armes et capacités sont également à votre disposition et offrent une infinité de possibilités pour ridiculiser votre adversaire ou vous faire ridiculiser.
Malgré une prise en main des touches instinctive et une très bonne jouabilité en général, ce jeu a de quelques défauts : Il n’est pas possible de jouer en ligne, ce qui de mon point de vue est du gâchis étant donnée la qualité du jeu. Les touches ne peuvent pas être attribuées à plusieurs joueurs lorsque l’on joue sur Clavier, ce qui laisse la liberté à quelques petits malins de vider votre stock de flèche en martelant votre touche. Je vous recommande donc d’utiliser une manette pour ce jeu, même si le clavier est largement suffisant si vous jouer assez peut avec vos amis, ou si ceux-ci sont plus raisonnables que les miens.
[h1]3/5[/h1]

[b]EN BREF[/b] procurez vous ce petit jeu si vous êtres un fan incommensurable des jeux d’arcade rétro, ou si vous souhaitez simplement passer un bon moment entre amis. Mais attention dans ce cas, n’oubliez pas vos manettes !
A savoir : A ce jeu viens s’ajouter un DLC, qui en échanges de quelques denier supplémentaires (bien évidement), vous donnerons accès à des personnages et arènes supplémentaires.

[h1]NOTE FINALE=16/20[/h1]

[i]Merci de votre lecture et bon jeu ![/i]
[url=http://www.towerfall-game.com/]Pour en savoir plus[/url]

37618518.review:
TowerFall Ascension is a platform, fast pased archer game. There is a challenge mode that can be played either solo or co-op, which can be quite difficult nearing the end levels.

However the MAIN reason to buy this game is multiplayer VS. My Friends and I have spent hundreds of hours shooting all kinds of arrows at each other and when we got board of that we added a bunch of modifiers, then played 100 hours more. There is a wide variaty of modifiers that can change the game to ensure you do not get bored easily. A few examples would be:

-Turning on random arrows for different set of starting arrows each round.
-Making all archers only able to carry one arrow, with a cursed bow that kills the archer that fires with know arrow in their quiver.
-Or even turning on unlimited drill arrows so at the start of the level you can turn and face the wall and spam the drill arrows as fast as you can through the wall in hopes you can kill the person on the other side of the map.

This is an amazing game with thousands of hours of multiplayer gaming with friends I highly recommend everyone fond of platforming, archery, and multiplayer  (all rolled into one) get this game as you will not regret it.

37138294.review:
My go-to local multiplayer game.
It's a game you can play with anybody who has ever held a controller, right away, without really having to explain in great detail what you are supposed to do and how. 
"You shoot your arrow with X and you jump with A. You have a limited number of arrows. There are treasure chests with bonus items poping up from time to time." 
When they get the hang of it by the second game: "By the way, you can dash with the shoulder buttons. While you are dashing you can grab arrow flying at you out of the air."
Everything else can be grasped by playing, and once you have those few rules down, you can start building your strategy, trying new stuff, and see what works.
There is of course a level of mastery you can get to in the game that will make you more or less unbeatable by someone just starting to play.  But that's par for the course for great party games that are not based on luck alone, and the default settings try to help out the players lagging behind in points by giving them a extra hit point a the start of the round.

There is also a great, and really challenging coop mode.
No online play, and playing alone against the CPU can be fun, but the game is first and foremost build to be a great local multyplayer experience.

34726114.review:
This is my favorite multiplayer game on Steam. There's nothing better than the panic of sitting on the couch with a friend and shouting at the TV while we scramble to stomp on one another's heads since we've already launched every arrow in our arsenal. This game has a wonderful cooperative quest mode for one or more players in addition to its versus mode. It can be very challenging at times but it always feels rewarding to complete a difficult stage. There's also a time attack mode for striking dummies and showing off.

Everything is animated beautifully, this isn't just another "retro" styled game with so much clunky movement. There are so many tiny details. A lot of care was put into making this game breathe; it looks and sounds wonderful.

The Dark World DLC is a good expansion on the game, it adds more cooperative levels, additional bosses to take down, alternate archer characters/outfits, as well as the addition of Steam Workshop support; you can create your own versus stages and share them with the community. 

IF Towerfall Ascension had online multiplayer I doubt I'd play much of anything else!

34352330.review:
I'll start by saying that this might just be the best local-multiplayer brawler on PC. Super easy to get into, fun to get better at, and perhaps most importantly, infinitely replayable.

It's also ridiculously polished. The art, music and sound design are all top-notch. The game manages to have this unique atmosphere that makes the matches that much more compelling.

Even unlocking things in this game is a blast, with stuff getting unlocked just from playing multiplayer matches like in smash bros. That's not the reason why unlocking the stages is fun though - it's the unique animations that play. For example, a piece of the moon in the background of one stage falls off, which then crashes down to earth on the map screen and BECOMES another stage! A very hype moment indeed! After that, the piece of the moon will be missing in the background of the original stage. It's attention to detail like this that make TowerFall that little bit better than other indie local multiplayer games. All these little quirks, and yet the gameplay doesn't suffer at all. You can tell a lot of love went into this game.

If you like having friends round for a night of gaming on the couch, then buying this is a no-brainer. I've not got the Dark World expansion yet, but I'll definitely be getting it as soon as it goes on sale!

34029190.review:
Although it's entirely based on one sole idea: Archers in a small space, there is enough polish and gameplay to hold your intrest for a long, long time. It is a true example of a simple theme, perfected. The pixel graphics and gameplay are polished to a "T", and feel entirely modern. 

The beauty in Towerfall is you never really "beat" it. You can beat the campaign, and the expansion's levels, but the campaign was never designed as the main attraction. Towerfall is meant to be played against your friends, side by side, on the couch. The campagn provides a challenge to complete with your friends, a sort of distraction from beating each other up, and a place to earn more stages and characters, but the real joy is  in the arena. 

The awards at the end of each match are hilarious, and pages of gameplay modifiers add to the depth. You can customize just about anything. There are hours and hours of intense, fast-pased, competition to be enjoyed here. A must-buy for anyone with people to play locally with.

There is no "skill cealing" here. With most games, once you reach a certain skill, you can play with just about anyone and there's no garanteeing who is going to win. The outcome of  a match in a game with  a skill celing is no longer based on the player's skill but other lucky or unlucky elements. In Towerfall, you will learn more and more new moves and techniques, and can really push the envelope on what you think should be possible in the game. There are guides on dash-cancelling, power-booping, and binking. Should you want to get competative, this game offers a similar scene to that of Super Smash Brothers. There isn't much more you could ask for in a couch multiplayer game.

33909854.review:
[h1][b]TL;DR: [/b]Jumpy and highly action-packed platformer with some interesting mechanics.[/h1]

There's a lot of single-screen platformers out there -- both single-player and multi-player based. And finding a marvel in the pile of shovelware is always nice, even though it's an extremely rare happening. As you might've guessed already, this one is one of the good ones.

So, basic gameplay is simple: you choose a hero, you enter a level, you shoot baddies with your bow. You have a lot to unlock, though -- new levels (each with new enemies), new difficulties, new challenges, new heroes even. Depth of the game is one it's main perks, honestly.

Another great side of Towerfall is the gameplay, of course -- fast paced action all around (speeding up even further on higher difficulties), it's as fun as it gets, especially if you're playing with a friend.

All in all, I would rate this game 8.5 out of 10 and would definitely recommend it to people who enjoys great pixel art, fast-paced platformers and casual archery. Also, consider the DLC if you'll like the game, as it adds on even more content.

Amazing game! 

* Incredibly well programmed.
* Funny right from the get go, but very high skill ceiling.
* Tons of settings that can be individually made for every archer. This makes it easy to balance the game for players of different skill. For example you can give a strong player only 1 arrow to start with (while the others have 3) and a weak player can get a shield. Also allows for some crazy rounds with OP arrows.
* Campaign is also great for co-op, especially the one from the DLC which is playable by up to 4 players (standard one is only for 2 players).

If you regularly play games with friends locally this is definitely worth the money.

31744129.review:
出乎意料的好玩!

TowerFall Ascension是一款本體為多人撕逼向遊戲，非常適合和親朋好友玩耍，操作簡單卻又具有深度。
但我沒有一起本地玩耍的親友所以只評單人(毆)

單人可玩的模式有:教程和coop模式
不要以為教程就只是教操作而已，其設計出乎意料的用心，幾乎每一關我都會發現一個新的遊戲技巧，同時你也可以在教程裡挑戰最短時間，是個簡潔又成功達到自然教學的典範設計。
coop模式可以在只有一名玩家的進行，其意義就是單人遊戲啦...在此模式裡一共有九個關卡可挑戰(不計DLC)，每個關卡都至少有5~8波敵人。
如果嫌太簡單還有困難模式可選!不過普通模式對我說夠難了，所以我只有打穿普通模式而已。

總體來說，TowerFall Ascension是一個輕鬆、簡潔無負擔的動作小品，但可別因此小瞧，敵人種類雖然不多但是可不好對付，從會從空中襲擊到會格檔玩家射擊，再到還會接箭射向玩家的敵人，頗有面對真人玩家的刺激感。
不難想像這款是當時OUYA主機上數一數二好玩的遊戲呢......但依然不能OUYA主機倒台(被巴)
比較遺憾的一點是，完全沒有劇情!完全沒有!雖然沒劇情也不影響遊戲就是了，好玩最重要嘛!

31725684.review:
I really loved this game for many reasons 
Here's why

First of all - Atmosphere
Really great overall
The pixel graphics are neither too complex nor too simple wich is ''cozy'' for the eyes
The soundtrack is nice and epic with an half 8-bit, half orchestra feeling to it
What's so great is that every level/tower /dungeon (whatever) has a different feeling to it making every arena feel unique.
8/10 on that part

Next - Gameplay
The best i've ever seen in a while honestly
At the start, all the controls are simple and easy to use (Press to aim, release to shoot - press to dash, press again to cancel - etc...) wich makes it easy to learn for new players.
BUT THEN, when you really get into it and practice, some crazy tech becomes available (Jump-cancel dash, crouch dash jump-cancel, dash-cancel shorthop etc...) wich can get really competitive.
So perfect for casuals but with a complicated side for the hardcore ''tech-ers''.

Finally - FUN
Play with friends, laugh, have fun, don't take life seriously etc.
You're gonna have a great time.

P.S. Yeah i do believe that the whole no-online mode was for the better
Lag would have not only made the game unenjoyable, but also unplayable and then the negative reviews would have flooded ham.

31485749.review:
5/5, easily. Based heavily upon the Humble Store (DRM-free + Steam key) release.

TowerFall: Ascension plays almost like a 2D Smash Bros, with a heavy focus on ranged combat and platforming. The mechanics are very arcadey. The multiplayer seems to have a focus on local co-op, which makes TowerFall sessions feel like a social activity. Some will gripe about the lack of online multiplayer, but I really think TowerFall is special for making you sit across the couch and hang out with people in physical proximity. The modest hardware requirements and Mac and Linux support add to TowerFall's accessibility. The Dark World expansion adds even more to the mix. All-in-all, TowerFall: Ascension is every bit worth owning. 

I've played TowerFall: Ascension with...
Linux Mint 17.3 64 bit and Windows 7 Home Premium 64 bit.
Nvidia GT 720, GT 730, and GT 610 graphics cards.
Core 2 Duo 3.33GHz, Pentium dual core 2.7GHz, and AMD Athlon 64 X2 2GHz CPUs.
Logitech F310 controller set to XInput.
Plays fantastic across the board!

30718807.review: TowerFall Ascension with the Dark World DLC is a FANTASTIC 2-4 player co-op game. It has been the most fun game I've played with friends out of the countless games we've tried. TowerFall kept us ingaged, entertained, and Challenged for over 4 hours. The only down side is that there isn't that many levels. We finished all the co-op levels in 4.3 hours on regular difficulty. With that there is multiple ways to make the levels more challenging including adding curses to your characters (de-buffs) and harder difficulties. The controls are very tight and confortable. The movement is very fluid and makes the gameplay that much more enjoyable. There is many unique systems in the game that add depth and take to master and perfect, Example: Dodging through projectiles or Holding Dodge to catch enemy projectiles to name a few. The games pixel art is good and even though the game plays in a square resolution no one seemed to mind or notice.  The Music isn't anything special in my opinion but it's good and does it's job. The Friendly Fire mechanic presents many memorable moments and funny conflicts between friends/team-mates. Finally the combat is exquisite. It's very fun to take down the many challenging enemies. You can try and pull off a shot or you can risk getting close and try the classic head smash. It's also very fun to go for unique shots or trick shots with different kinds of arrows (Bomb/Super Bomb, Drill, Reflecting, Etc.). I'm looking forward to playing it again in the PvP modes and replaying co-op with harder difficulties.

30041216.review:
This game is amazing! Mix of great controls, fun gameplay, enjoyable music and rich art style.

Controls:
Let it be known I haven't played this game with a keyboard. Upon seeing this game I instantly knew it was a controller only game in style. Owning both a Xbox 360 controller and a steam controller I gave both a whirl and was excited to see it was a match made in heaven. Controls work well and create a fluid playing experience. Beautifully work together with the gameplay.

Gameplay: 
OH BOY THE GAMEPLAY. This game rewards skill but allows anyone to enjoy playing. With a smashbros style of item giving that never over powers anyone you have a balance of power. Constantly winning starts giving buffs to the losing parties to boost their chances. But what’s impressive is even when you are without any ammo to shoot, you can still win. It's impressive how balanced this feels!

Music and Art:
The music is fun and full of energy creating a great atmosphere to play in and works well with the pixallated art style. The pixal style works well with the smiple but complex gameplay and creates easy visuals that don't stress the eyes and allow for great mechanical use in playing.

Add in the fact of steam workshop and you have a great perfect game I can't help but recomm-

No I can't recommend this as there is a HUGE flaw. When it comes to games I myself can usually overlook one thing, but this is impossible. This game is clearly a multiplayer experience. Towerfall is meant to be enjoy with friends. But this is a multiplayer game with local play only. This flaw is far too huge to overcome the fact the rest of the game is near perfect combat enjoyment. I would love to have hundreds of hours in this game, truly I would. But I can't because I can't enjoy this game with my friends. 

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNTIL SOME FORM OF ONLINE MULTIPLAYER IS ADDED. The only way this purchase is worth your time is if you have a house full of people willing to join you in this game. This is the only good game that I have ever enjoyed but regretted purchasing.

Edit: while it is listed that this game is "Local Multiplayer only" That in itself can be a flaw. In this case it very much is. If a "feature" of a game hinders (or improves) the enjoyment of the game, that is a fair element to review.

Best couch co-op (or versus) game I've ever played, seriously. Whenever my friends come home and we start playing couch co-op or versus games we end up revisiting Towerfall over and over again. It's just so... pure fun! Balanced, great pixel graphics, nice variety of levels and modes (pvm, pvp, custom maps which may involve minigames of some sort, match variables, different arrows...). 27983279.review:
Short version:
This is just amazing party game for local multiplayer sessions. Solo-players don't bother.

Long:
We are having monthly tradition with group of 4 gamers (3 guys, 1 girl). It's been so for ages, that we start our gaming evening with Towerfall, and we end it with Towerfall.
This game just have it all. Excellent and accurate controls for "skill" play, as well as our casual gaming evenings. Also the maps and powerups are in good balance among different players and the "handicap" within rounds works well. The balance seems to be just great. We cannot say who would have been winning most of our rounds, since it's impossible to say who will win the match until the very end.
I guess this game has been resource for more cursing and yelling than all other games combined.

Definitely pick this one if you are into couch multiplayer with few friends.
If you play this on your own, then i think you should continue looking for something else, since world is full of good single player games by design.

27958528.review:
I never took the time to write a review before because I wanted to do it correctly and elaborate my opinion.
But with the steam awards badge I needed to jump in and write a review to get the full badge. I didn't what to rush a review to get this badge so I choose the game I nominated for which the review is the simplest : the game I nominated in the custom category as "local multiplayer essential".

My opinion on it is easy to express : it's simply awsome ! :D
Whenever we are aving LANs with friends or are just a small group gathered there is often a time when we want to have fun with a local multiplayer game and Towerfall is the go-to game in this case.
It's really simple to learn but offers a lot of surprising and intense enconters thanks to the variety of arrows, the little interaction with terrain, the warping of the map in a snake-like fation, the dodges...
And all of this awsome gameplay is coming with beatifull pixel art graphics and a variety of little fun touches that you enjoy discovering throughout the game : the characters and map unlocks, the hats that can be removed by an arrow coming too close, the original awards at the end of each match...

Add to this a coop and a challenge mode that are both solid (even if for me the core of the game is the versus) and the possibility to tweak the rules of the match to add interesting twists (controlable ghosts, exploding bodies, slow time...) and you've good an awsome game with a clean and elegant design that is always fun to play for one more match :D

Plus, the extension is good too but I'll talk about it in a specific review if I do one (spoiler alert : new cool maps/arrow/character design and bosses 4-player coop => it's really good ^^)

27580047.review:
Anyone who knows me knows how highly I hold this game. From a design perspective it does everything right - very simple mechanics that have huge hidden depth once you slowly and naturally get the hang of them. It's an accessible party game that doubles as my favorite competitive game of all time, seriously if you check out the reddit/wiki/youtube vods of tournaments, the meta is always evolving. Even the lore of the game is seemingly minimal at first but there's a lot of hidden depth there that becomes apparent after playing through the campaign and paying attention to level scenery and the unlock sequences for different characters.

With the Dark World expansion TowerFall becomes one of those rare perfectly complete games. I finally just finished beating the dev times on all the Dark World trials (first person in the world to do so!), and I'm looking forward to competing at the Genesis 4 tournament! Please get this game and get good and help to grow the scene!

27347655.review:
This is a game that you HAVE to play with other people.  Its single player mode is tacked on and hollow (much like many modern games). I cannot recommend it if you're looking for a good single player experience. However, its incredible multiplayer more than justifies the game's reasonable asking price if you have a few controllers. While the Dark World expansion fleshes out the campaign, it is still best enjoyed when you have a few friends to share in the rage. One MAJOR caveat: the game has no online multiplayer. While the reasoning is understandable, (the game has mechanics timed down to individual frames and would be a subpar experience if there's any amount of latency involved) I believe having a poor online mode would still be superior to not having one at all.

Barring those few criticisms, Towerfall Ascension is a gem of a local multiplayer brawler. You play as one of several archers (that vary only cosmetically) and have a limited number of arrows (3 by default). Once you shoot an arrow, it is left on the world and you must pick it up by walking over it. Your movement and aiming is combined into a single control, which takes some getting used to if you're new to the genre. You are only able to move and aim in 8 principle directions. The arrows you shoot home slightly if there's an enemy in range, and there are multiple arrow types that range from exploding to bouncing to piercing. Each attack is an instant kill, regardless of whether it was through shooting your opponent with an arrow, hitting them with an arrow's secondary effect, or stomping their heads in. There is also dodging, which is both your defense and mobility ability. And finally, there is screen wrap, where the top/bottom and left/right of the screen are connected.

It was designed from the ground up to be played locally, and accommodates both casual and competitive play. The default game mode on headhunter is perfect for people who have never played the game, with just enough rubber-banding to keep everyone in the game without being egregious (nothing like Mario Kart's first to worst from a single blue shell). Each round is paced well, and no one ever stays hopeless or dead for too long. You can go down the list of maps to gradually introduce your friends to new items, and never really overwhelm them (unless you want to).

If you're playing casually with experienced players, custom game modes vastly increase the replayability of an already replayable game. Small tweaks like spawning with special arrows or returning as ghosts result in significant changes in how you play. And finally, making an asymmetric custom mode (2v1/3v1 team death match) where one player gets huge bonuses (such as regenerating shields and arrows) while the opposing team gets an advantage in numbers is almost like playing an entirely new game. Even the more chaotic game modes (like infinite drill arrows or infinite laser arrows) are good for a round or two before you abandon them and pretend they never existed.

And finally, the game is very well balanced competitively. Dodge cancelling and superjumping are difficult mechanics to master, and yield a surprisingly high skill ceiling. While there are a few oddities for a competitive game (bolt arrows finding your opponent's home from 3 zipcodes away, kicking their dog, then brutally murdering them right in the face comes to mind) it's nothing that custom rules can't fix. Because everyone has the same attacks and abilities, the only thing that sets players apart is their positioning, skill, and reflexes. 

Towerfall Ascension is an amazing game that I highly recommend if and only if you play local multiplayer games. Do not buy this game if you're looking for a single player game or a good story (mediocre and nonexistent respectively). However, Towerfall Ascension is one of the best local multiplayer games out there. If you own a few controllers and have people over occasionally, this game is almost mandatory.

26908520.review:
O jogo foi inicialmente lançado para o Ouya, e era conhecido como o jogo que faria você querer um Ouya, e não demorou muito para que a sua popularidade crescesse a ponto de fazer a internet clamar por uma versão para as outras plataformas e o deus dos games ouviu as nossas preces e fez com que o joguinho fosse lançado para Steam e PS4!

O jogo tem uma jogabilidade relativamente simples, cada jogador é um arqueiro que tem 3 flechas em sua aljava e o objetivo de matar os arqueiros inimigos, seja com uma flechada ou pulando em sua cabeça. Os movimentos também são simples, pulo, pulo na parede e desviar, e segredo é saber quando usá-los, um pulo na hora errada pode te tornar um belo cadáver, lembrando que se você usa o movimento de desviar, que basicamente é um das para o lado que você estiver direcionando o personagem, e uma flecha te acerta durante o movimento você pega essa flecha para você. Basicamente esse é um jogo de agilidade, habilidade, estratégia e muitas vezes de sorte, muita sorte.

As partidas são extremamente rápidas e dinâmicas, em menos de cinco minutos geralmente se decide um mata-mata de 4 jogadores de 5 rounds, e é nessa dinamicidade que o jogo se torna rapidamente um vício, já que você sempre fica com aquele sentimento de “Só mais uma! Agora com certeza eu vou acertar!”. O jogo também tem o modo co-op e na expansão TowerFall Dark World são adicionados boss nas fases de co-op, basicamente esse jogo tem diversão para todo tipo de pessoa. Eu recomendo extremamente que você corra atrás e jogue!

Uma coisa que eu não podia deixar de falar é a arte pixelada desse jogo! Mano, essa arte ♥! O jogo tem esse estilo “low pixel” como se fosse um jogo bem antigo, mas a dinâmica das animações e os detalhes de iluminação são feitos de forma que contrastem com o estilo simplificado dos sprites fazendo uma composição incrível! Tem um detalhe em específico que eu vibro toda vez que eu vejo, que é quando a flecha passa perto da cabeça do personagem e o chapéu do seu personagem cai! Eu sei que é um detalhe que não muda em nada o jogo, mas eu acho isso incrível!

Resumindo, esse é um jogo que eu recomendo para TODAS as pessoas, o único ponto fraco do jogo é também o ponto forte dele, já que não existe multiplayer online, apenas local. Então se você tem amiguinhos, junte eles dividam o valor do joguinho e muitas jogatinas para vocês! ;D

26066912.review:
I originally played this game via PS+ for a number of hours on the PlayStation 4, but I had to get this when I saw such an enticing 50% discount. Of course, within two or three hours, I beat my progress on the PS4 version. This game is incredibly fun, and it's actually relatively versatile, too. Depending on how you like to play, you could:
•Play with others, where this becomes a fun, lethal, adrenaline-pumping contest, OR;
•Play on your own against the evil forces of something, where this becomes the single most stressful, rage-inducing, soul-destroying game ever.

The idea of playing with archers is really well thought-out, and it has several mechanics which are absolutely brilliant. The major one is dodging, where you can dash into arrows and collect them. You'll find out just how important that is in singleplayer, where you're often facing multiple enemy archers at once. Speaking of the archers, their AI is horrifyingly efficient, and they tend to kill you in CQC even when out of arrows.

The soundtrack for this game is absolutely beautiful, and right from the start of the main menu theme, you get the feeling that this is going to be a good game. And TowerFall: Ascension does not disappoint me. It's a beautiful game and it is definitely worth the money.

25802730.review:
As many others have said, this game has no online multiplayer so keep that in mind. I wish it did, but also respect the developer's opinion that the number of variables he can't control (lag, disconnects, etc) would harm the quality of an incredibly well-controlled twitch game.

The level of detail in the art, sound, and overall design is just astounding. The controls are surprisingly simple to pick up and play, we've had Towerfall as a regular party game for years now and have seen newbies and non-gamers (even ones usually shy about games) pick up the controller without hesitation and do impressively well. And yet this ease of entry doesn't detract one bit from the skill ceiling: if you're ready for the next level there are plenty of techniques to escalate to for high-level play including dodge cancels, frame-perfect grabs and of course HYPER JUMPS!

If you fancy yourself pretty good at the game the competitive scene is worth taking a look at. I know at least one team in San Francisco trains and holds tournaments regularly. Towerfall tournaments are regularly hosted at gaming events such as PAX, Evo, GDC, the list goes on, so if you're going to these keep an eye out!

25778305.review:
Excellent local-multiplayer game.  If you've got the controllers and friends for it, then buy it.

[h1]Positives:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Extremely fast paced, rounds usually last only a minute or two
[*]Simple controls, easy to learn, difficult to master.  Controls default are move, jump, shoot, and dodge.  Shoot your opponents or jump on their heads to kill them.  You can catch arrows by dodging at the right time.
[*]Different weapons and powerups (Bomb arrows, bolt arrows, etc) make play very interesting.  There is abundance, and everything has a use.
[*]The pac-man style looping of the levels is awesome.  Shoot through the left site to hit the right side, fall through the bottom to get to the top.
[*]Good handicapping for the players in the lead/behind.  If you're in the lead you get less arrows at start.  If you're last you get a free shield.  This levels the field and makes games fun for both beginners and veterans.
[*]Lots of options, virtually everything can be toggled.
[*]Cheat codes exist to unlock everything, in case you don't ever want to play this single-player.
[*]Your friends will rage at you when you catch all of the arrows then proceed to stomp on their heads instead of shooting them.
[*]Arrows have a very slight tracking, if the initial shot is close enough.  This takes the thought out of whether or not you should shoot.
[*]DLC has enough new stuff to justify the price, but is absolutely not required to have fun.
[*]Game is damn fun.
[*]There are hilarious awards given at the win screen based on how you and your opponents played.  I think I got a "bomb squad" award for catching bomb arrows, or "super booper" for jumping on a lot of heads.
[/list]


[h1]Negatives:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Single player campaign is overly hard.  Thankfully all levels/characters can be unlocked by a cheat code.  I have a feeling that if you can play through the single player most of your friends will not want to play with you because you'll become "too good".
[*]Versus becomes better the more players you have.  2 player is meh, 3 player is above-average, 4 player is insane fun.
[*]No internet multi-player.   This especially hurts if you have multiple friends that own this game and want to keep unlocks in sync without resorting to the cheat code.
[*]Some of the stuff to do the level/character unlocks is insanely hard.
[*]Playing without a controller is a bad idea.
[/list]

24717743.review:
This game is a hoot with a full couch of friends. Its crazy how it got us all jumping and screaming for the entire time we were playing. I remember getting this in a indiebox and thinking "meh what a crappy game for this month". But being able to finally play it with a full group finally made it worthwhile. 

The gameplay is fun and hectic. You get only a single life per round. Each round lasts anywhere from a handful of seconds to usually no longer then a minute. So players aren't left on the sidelines too long if they die in the very first second making a dumb move. Every arena is randomly generated and are usually very well balanced.  Every exit on the level links directly to the corrosponding opposite side. So that opens up a world of crazy encounters with groups that know how to use them creativly. The powerups add a whole level of craziness with the level moving vertically or horizontally. Which can disoritente some players and give others the chance to move in for a kill. Depending on who is winning and losing the game adds simple handicaps that gives others a chance to win even if they have lost a lot of rounds back to back. Some of the handicaps simply add a sheild allowing you to withstand a extra strike or helps bend your arrows to make it easier to strike a oppoent down. While leaders will have fewer arrows to start and most use pure skill to outwit their oppoents handicaps. It sounds like it make it unfair. But for me after all my years of multiplayer gaming. I can say this game is one of the very few that figured out how to make a fair and balanced handicap system.

Bottomline. If you have a local group of friends that get together to play games. BUY THIS. You will have a blast.

I recieved this product for free from a Steam support person to troubleshoot some issues I was having with the Steam controller on other games.  Man am I glad they gave it to me.  I never would've gotten it otherwise, but honestly I would even consider recommending this game at full price.  It doesn't look like it's remotely worth it's price at first look, or even necessarily at the first bit of playing.  But the boss design is AMAZING, the music is tight, and in general it's a real fun game.  The hardest levels/bosses on the hardest modes are extremely challenging, but well designed.  It sits on the cusp of what feels like artificial difficulty at times (as if certain attacks/events cannot be avoided), but then with practice you learn that even the hardest attacks or enemies are avoidable with enough skill.  The difficulty curve is also well designed in my opinion.

Funnily enough, I got almost nothing out of the versus multiplayer mode.  It's fine, I guess.  Very bland if you ask me, although if you're looking for something more fair and less chaotic it's good.  I think most groups of friends are looking more for smash bros and would have more fun playing that.

But the co-op and single player modes can't be beat.  10/10 coop, 10/10 single player, 8/10 trials mode, and 7/10 versus mode from me.  I have 100%'d the game and put about 100 hours in doing so.

24098318.review:
MattMakesGames has always made crazy platformer games with high amount of death, which is NOT caused by:
- Falling down, because like the old platformer games, falling down a hole means you pop up upstairs instead.
- Falling on enemies. While colliding with the enemy causes you to die, booping on enemies (even players in a versus match) has been a method proven by magical plumbers everywhere as the best method of elimination.
- Running out of arrows. Have I told you this game is all about arrows? Shooting arrows, picking up stray arrows from walls, dodging AND grabbing arrows out of the air (the mystical tower archery training paid off). You will always find amusement in arrows flying everywhere and people trying to aim at little pixelated sprites with only 8 possible directions and a brilliant projectile physics...until you get shot in the face, of course.

However, glorious, hilarious deaths will certainly be caused by:
- DIfferent arrows that comes in form of a powerup from a loot chest. Be it explosions, bounces of walls, floor hazard generation, there's arrows to suit every kind of your archery needs.
- Flavourful enemies, some only spawn in certain levels. Be it the nearly-harmless slime, pestering ghosts, and dark hooded figures with pointy tools that can deflect your shots, it's better to end them before they end you.
- Getting shot in the face by a wily foe on versus mode
- Getting shot in the back by a sneaky foe on versus mode
- Getting shot in the back by an ally on co-op mode
- Shooting an arrow up, missing that goddamn bird and watch as the arrow plunge down right to your own character
- Lava. I mean, if Matt Thorson made a platformer game without floor hazards, people would flip.
- Getting shot in the face by your own bouncy arrow.
- Getting shot in the face by someone else's bouncy arrow.
- Trying to play single-string guitar with your bow...with Cursed Bow mod turned on.
- Getting divebombed from above (read: booped), Super Mario style.
- Failing dodge.
- Succeeding dodge and still get shot.
- Succeeding dodge, stole their bouncy arrow, tries to shoot them and ends up bouncing it at a wall and back to one's face.
- And many more.

It has huge replayability value when you play at couch coop with your friends. Done co-op on normal mode? Go hardcore. Done versus on normal mode? Turn on random mods and have a good laugh (or ruin your friendship). I wish they would expand on the story by adding narration and further the coop campaign, but I think that's what the Dark World expansion is for (I haven't checked). I have played coop with my brother and it has been such a blast that I wish the players can immerse further by adding background stories or certain triggers.

I highly recommend this for: 
- Fans of MattMakesGames' old platformer games like Runman, Jumper and Untitled Story (that one with the birdthing).
- Those who are looking for a great couch coop game, playable sober or drunk.
- Fans of mechanically-challenging games. The platformer, jumping of walls, all the while trying to aim an arrow will be a great experience for you.
- Fans of great pixel arts and detailed, fleshed out game assets.

23596404.review:
I, at first, thought that his was going to be one of these "play once and forget" type of games. But no, there's an entire story/quest mode, play alone or with your friends, still a lot of fun. There's trials when you want to test your speed and there's vs. mode that's also incredibly fun with friends. When you have the DLC (that I think is a tad expensive) you can also desing your own levels. There's always room for improvement, you think you've mastered shooting arrows? Think again.

The sound and graphics are also awesome. Music, even if you try to beat a level to get the golden skull never gets dull and is really well made. Animations and other effects do not clutter the game but only enhance.

It also runs well on low-end PCs and very well on Linux.

23574464.review:
2D pixel art screenwrap deathmatch with precision archery and jumpdashing

Towerfall is a wonderful local co-op and multiplayer game.  There is a singleplayer mode, but the game is very obviously focused on couch co-op and versus matches.  I've been playing this on the Steambox in my living room for a little over a year now and it is probably the most-played game on that system.  The mechanics are easy to learn but difficult to master, with tons of replay value and several unlockable characters and stages.  Stylish and polished, with a great soundtrack to boot.

10/10, cannot recommend this game enough

23520491.review:
TowerFall est un jeu que je conseille systématiquement à tous ceux et celles qui cherchent à mettre la main sur un nouveau jeu pour jouer en groupe autour d’un même écran. La musique est excellente, le jeu est beau, amusant et pas très cher pour ce qu’il nous offre. Les différents modes de jeu solo offrent un défi considérable aux amateurs de jeux d’action ainsi qu’à ceux et celles qui désirent peaufiner leurs talents pour mieux éclater la gueule de leurs adversaires. Quoi que le jeu ne supporte pas le jeu en ligne, le mode versus en local fait très bien le travail pour animer les soirées de gaming entre amis, des heures de plaisir sont garanties!

On aime :
- Superbe trame sonore
- Style artistique réussi, un bonbon pour les amateurs du style rétro
- Le mode multijoueurs local est amusant et captivant
- Offre un mode solo permettant d’obtenir des trucs utilisables en multijoueurs
- Contrôles intuitifs et simples à maîtriser
- Une grande variété dans les arènes de combat
- Supporte le Steam Workshop, augmente considérablement la longévité du jeu

On aime moins :
- Le mode de jeu solo est TRÈS difficile à compléter, peut en décourager plusieurs
- L’expansion « Dark World » est nécessaire pour accéder au Steam Workshop
- Ne possède pas de mode multijoueurs en ligne

SCORE FINAL : 9

Critique complète : http://www.lantredugeek.com/critique-towerfall-ascension/

It really brings out a nervous laugh when you ALMOST killed your friend with an arrow, you actually hit his hat off his head, or when you kill yourself with your own arrow and can only blame yourself. The arrows in the game are pleasantly homing, rewarding you putting faith in the homing ability of it. It is quite satisfying. 22900313.review:
Absolutely awesome co-op game nothing more to it. if you are looking for a fun game to play with your friends can i only say "You have come to the right place".

[h1] The Game [/h1]
- The game is archers jumping around shooting at each other which doesnt sound like something special but the greatest games are often simple and straight forward and this one is no exception. there is a ton of game-modes aswell as mechanics that changes the characters, environment and the arrows to suit whatever needs you may have. there is a quest mode and a versus mode aswell as a trial mode so you can train you skills, go out on adventure and pwn your friends, what more can you ask for. i've had a lot of fun playing with my friends over at school aswell as home and each session is the same story. hours of fun with great laughs and some good memories. 

- the two biggest disadvantages when it comes to playing the game is it's not much of an singleplayer game so you will need someone to play with to get the best experience. the second one in my opinion is getting a gamepad/controller. the mechanichs aswell as the controls were designed for a controller and improves the gamepley immensly :).

- You can't play this game online with your friends which of course is somewhat of a bummer but the reasoning behind it makes up for it. the game is very responsive and very easily comes down to miliseconds of who wins and who gets shoot in the face. so if there were to be an online version the delay aswell as the possible host-advantage would reduce the quality of the games you play. but it doesnt really matter that you can't play online with your friends because this isn't a game you play online. it's a game you get together and have a good time which probably is the best way of playing with your friends. so even though the game can't be played online will it never mean anything since you will be playing it will your pals right next to you :D

Greatly recommended. 
the dark world edition doesnt add extremely much gameplay but if you are into the game is it a good use of your money.

I read some good reviews about Towerfall and thought: Well... why not? after all I was not really thinking of my main computer as a multiplayer machine or anything but I would often welcome my friends and we would play something on the PS3, it took some effort to set up the controllers on the PC, but ever since Towerfall those have not been paired to the PS3 anymore or at least not for long.

Towerfall is an incredibly fun game to play with your friends, it's easy to get into it, the concept is easy enough to grasp and then shooting arrows at each other with little sprites make you feel like some sort of elven hero, a good game is the sort of game that inspires stories as you play and seeing three of your friends gang up against you is a lot of fun when everyone starts yelling.

- If you like to play with friends get this game.
- If you want a challenging game for yourself, get this game.
- If you are doubting that Steam could become a great platform for couch multiplayer, get this game.

Brings around nostalgia for skill-based local co-op games in a big way. 
The campaign mode might be challenging, yes, but the multiplayer is where the real fun begins. ENVOY RATED: 10/10

2- Use controllers! (For everyone obviously)
3- No online, you can only play locally.

It's a party/group game, and if you have at least 3 controllers and 2 friends that can come over then this game is amazing, it's some much fun!

Wow.  I can't stand this game.  

The challenge seems to rely on how sloppy the controls are.  That in itself is an immediate turn-off.  The graphics aren't too hot either, but given the recent 8-bit retro style trend in many indie games, I can more or less let that slide.  The sound track was okay.    

It's a multiplayer game which can *only* be played through local co-op/VS mode.  In theory, that shouldn't count negatively for it.  Realistically though, how often do you and your friends have time to get together and play a local co-op game?  For me and my pals that doesn't happen too terribly often, and when it does, we play better games than this.  

I got this in a bundle, otherwise I would be pretty pissed about the purchase.  It is NOT worth $15.  Maybe if you find it on sale for 75% off and you have easy access to a pal who can join you on a regular basis, then, yes, it's worth the buy.  Otherwise, avoid it.

20138229.review:
Tl;dr: Towerfall is one of the best local multiplayer games ever made.

The one thing that stands out about Towerfall is how it utilizes simplicity to an amazing extent - basing the whole game on one simple mechanic of shooting arrows. Sure, different arrows and other powerups keep it fresh, but the core design is so strong - playing without any powerups in a simple map doesn't get boring after the 5000th round. Adding to the variety are the modifiers in Versus mode, which just adds to the number of hilarious deaths.

But make no mistake - multiplayer is very competitive with the *right* opponents (and this is one reason which may put off people - there is no online multiplayer). The game is a good example of easy to get into, hard to master. I'm fortunate enough to have friends who're also into this game, so I've had some pretty tough competition to level up.

The Quests are where Towerfall is at its weakest, but the weakest sections are still pretty strong. The game technically isn't long - if you're good at the game it'll barely take you 4 minutes per level to beat it in Normal without retries. The length, however, comes from the retries. But really, the feeling of beating Ascension in Hardcore mode after the 400th try is priceless.

I'm a bit conflicted about the Dark World expansion though. It's definitely a good expansion, adding 4 new characters and (effectively) 4 single player quests with a restructuring of how quests are played (different arenas as opposed to different rounds in the same arena in the original) - but I'm not sure whether that justifies the price. Multiplayer is almost the same, just with more maps and characters (and since there are no character-specific abilities, that doesn't mean much).

So basically, main game - must buy. Expansion - should buy.

This is one of the greatest local multiplayer games I've ever played. Matches are short, unpredictable, rewarding, and very intense. If you have a couple people at home that would be willing to put in a couple hours a week, or some buddies to invite over for a game night, this game is well worth the money.

Pros
> 2-4 player versus, 1-2 player quests, 1-4 player horde mode, 1 player training
> a HUGE amount of match modifiers for versus matches that you can randomize or save as presets
> frantic, skill based gameplay with a pinch of luck to stir things up
> low learning curve, but a high skill cap

Cons
> no online multiplayer
> no expansive story mode
> lackluster single player experience
> can't save full match replays, only the final kill-cam

19492506.review:
So you are thinking about getting Towerfall Ascension. Well gather around and I shall tell you a story about Dungeons and Dragons... On second thought I will just tell you about Towerfall.

Story: If you are looking for an enriching story, look somewhere else. You won't find it here. There is a story, but its all spoiled by the trailer on this page.

Graphics: If you are looking for the next generation of graphics, you definitely won't find it here. But you probably already know that since you probably watched the trailer that spoiled the story. Good artstyle though. 

Gameplay: If you like zipping through levels at high speed with no second thought whatsoever, then you will almost immediately die. This game requires a lot of thought and skill. Sometimes you will lose visibility of your character since there are going to be some split second decisions. LET ME STRESS THIS: YOU WILL DIE A LOT!

BIG CRITICISM I HAVE (NOTICE THE CAPS): THIS GAME HAS NO ONLINE MULTIPLAYER. TOWERFALL IS BASICALLY ASKING TO HAVE AN ONLINE COMPONENT TO IT. I FOUND MYSELF ON THE LAST LEVEL THINKING I NEED SOME HELP TO GET THROUGH THIS. BUT WILL I EVER FIND THE HELP THAT I NEED? NOPE! (I DON'T SEE MY FRIENDS TO OFTEN, SO I CAN'T EXACTLY PLAY LOCAL MULTIPLAYER.) VERSUS MODE NEEDS ONLINE MULTIPLAYER. BIG OPPORTUNITY MISSED.
THE TIME TRIAL MODE IS ANOTHER THING THAT I HAVE BEEF WITH. THE TIME TRIALS AREN'T REALLY FUN AT ALL. THERE IS NOTHING REDEEMING ABOUT THEM. ONCE YOU GET DONE WITH IT, YOU WILL PROBABLY NEVER GO BACK TO IT. THIS COULD HAVE EASILY BEEN FIXED WITH A online (lowercase for emphasis) LEADERBOARD. MAKING IT A COMPETITION TO GET ONE OF THE FASTEST TIMES WOULD HAVE MADE IT A TON BETTER AND WOULD HAVE CAUGHT MY EYE A LITTLE MORE.
THE CHARACTERS ARE THE SAME. THERE IS NO DIFFERING QUALITIES THAT MAKE THE CHARACTERS UNIQUE ASIDE FROM THEIR NAMES AND COSTUMES. THEY ALL PLAY THE SAME AND THEY ALL USE A BOW AND ARROW. I THINK THAT THIS GAME WOULD HAVE BEEN A LOT MORE INTERESTING IF THERE WERE DIFFERING WEAPONS AND PLAYSTYLES FOR EACH CHARACTER. IT WOULD HAVE EASILY BEEFED UP THE REPLAY VALUE IN THIS GAME. INSTEAD, I FOUND MYSELF USING WHICH EVER CHARACTER I LANDED ON AFTER I CLOSED MY EYES AND COUNTED TO 5 AS I SCROLLED THROUGH ALL THE CHARACTERS. THE GAMEPLAY IS SO REPETITIVE (but it is fun) THAT CHOOSING A DIFFERENT CHARACTER DOESN'T REALLY MATTER. I THINK THE ONLY REASON WHY THEY ADDED ALL THESE CHARACTERS IS BECAUSE OF THE VERSUS MODE. A MODE WHICH THEY FORGOT TO PUT online IN.

Final Verdict: If you like repetitive gameplay, no depth in story or characters, no online multiplayer, a game mode that doesn't have any redeeming qualities whatsoever, and a game that you will pay $15 for and will last you about 3 hours just to do the main campaign, then this is the perfect game for you.
But seriously this game is by no means bad. The gameplay is top notch and will last you a lot more than 3 hours. The replay value is definitely there, but it could have been a game I could have gotten extremely addicted to if it added all the things I said. THIS GAME COULD HAVE DEFINITELY BENEFITTED FROM HAVING online MULTIPLAYER. If you have friends and you see them a lot, then this game will most likely be perfect for you guys. 

AND IF THE DEVELOPERS EVER SEE THIS REVIEW, I WOULD JUST LIKE TO SAY, ADD online!

18935085.review:
This is just about the funnest multiplayer game I have ever played. EVER. EVERRRRRRRRRRRRRR.

It's like Super Smash Bros., if Super Smash Bros. was like Quake, and without bullshit balance issues because the characters all function the same. It's a 3-button game, yet there is so much technique to it and so much that can happen at any moment. It can get super twitchy, but in the best possible way, and it is super fast and frantic and there can be super freaking intense standoffs. The music and the visuals are freaking incredible and detailed and memorable as fuck. Lots of funny little sound effects and secret sneaky things that can happen, me and my family and friends are always discovering new things with this game. There is not really any story thrown in your face, and yet it seems like such a rich and unique fantasy world that you can sort of piece together in a vague, Dark Souls-like fashion. Singleplayer/co-op is fun too. There are so many secrets and unlockables, and it's always amazing and mindblowing to witness. There's also trials, which will seriously test your speed at shooting a set of dummies. Good luck getting even one diamond time.

Basically, this is a must-play multiplayer game that you gotta experience for yourself and you just need to freaking buy it right the fuck now, if you have friends around who will play with you and gamepads. There WILL be screaming. I don't usually give out number scores in these Steam reviews, but this easily an all-time classic 10/10 game, forever and ever and EVER. Perfect, perfect, perfect... BUY IT, BEEYITCH.

18932985.review:
Great local multiplayer game to play with friends. The combat and dodge systems are easy enough for any new player to pick up, but challenging enough to keep matches fresh and challenging for hours. The game's pixel art style is colorful and simple, but lends itself to a suprising variety in the visual design of the maps, powerups, and characters. Matches are fast and hectic, ensuring that no player stays dead for too long, while also making winning a match feel like a test of reflex and skill. I could go on and on about how fun this game is, but honestly it needs to be experienced with friends first-hand to understand just what a fantastic multiplayer experience Towerfall really is.
   I do have a few gripes with the game, however. There is no online multiplayer, which, especially on pc, is kind of a big deal if you dont have any friends to play with locally. This is made worse by the fact that the single player modes in this game feel more like an afterthought than equal substitutes for multiplayer. I should really stress this point, [b]do not buy this game if you do not have people to play local multiplayer with [/b].
   Those gripes aside, Towerfall really is a stellar game, and one I'll be playing with friends for many
hours to come.
    
8/10
   + Amazing multiplayer
   + Fun art style
    -  no online
    -  mediocre single player

18812882.review:
[b]Note: This game can only be played locally. There is no online multiplayer whatsoever.[/b]

Spectacular battle arena-type game focused on fast-paced bow and arrow oriented combat, with mechanics that are very approachable and, for the most part, easy to figure out on your own. The relative transparency of its mechanics does not, however, mean that it is an easy game to master, with its tight controls, twitch counterplay mechanics, and well-crafted, deceptive arenas. A notable feature is the added dimension of screen wrapping - players or objects that pass through the bottom of the screen will come out through the top, left side through the right, and vice versa. Should you decide to pick the game up, you will soon discover what a devilish thing this can be.

The game is split into three modes: Versus, Co-op, and Trials. The Versus mode pits 2-4 players against one another in one of three different sub-modes, all focused on killing the opposing players, with a large number of game modifiers available that change the games in a variety of ways. There are a large number of stages available, some of which have to be unlocked through various means. Co-op mode (perhaps more aptly called "Quest mode", as it can be played and enjoyed perfectly well as a solo experience) is a mode that pits you and a friend (up to three friends in the expansion's version of co-op) against waves of different enemies on each of the themed maps. There's not much more to it than that, but it is enjoyable and provides for some challenge if you're going for achievements. Lastly, Trials is a time trial mode that challenges you to destroy a number of dummies as quickly as possible with the tools available in each stage. It's somewhat maddening, but engrossing for the obsessive.

Overall there is little about the game that I can fault. The most notable flaw is its lack of online multiplayer, the exclusion of which may well have been intentional, as the game appears to have been constructed to strongly encourage getting together and duking it out with a group of friends. Even so, I would recommend it as a singleplayer game due to its inherent charm and the challenges it provides in its Quest and Trial modes, although I imagine a lot of people would disagree with me on this point. I'm just a sucker for a good challenge wrapped into a neat little package. I expect I will be returning to this game many times in the future.

18669282.review:
一画面完結型のアクションゲームで、印象としてはよく動くマリオブラザーズと言った感じ。
ゲーム内容も昔のアーケードゲームさながらにシンプルかつ高難易度。
ただの雑魚敵かと思いきや、攻撃を防いだり避けたりするのは序の口で、後半になるとSTGのように撃ち返しをしてくる敵や壁を突き抜けてくる敵まで出てくる。
そんなクセのある敵が遠慮なしにボコボコ召喚されるため、なるべくスポーンキルを狙っていかないと取り返しがつかなくなったりと、段々覚えゲーになっていくところが個人的にすごく気に入っている。

そして自キャラの操作性も悪くない。
特に気に入っているのがスライディングジャンプの挙動。
これがQuakeのストレイフジャンプばりに飛ぶので、このスライディングジャンプを駆使して画面内を縦横無尽に移動するのが楽しい。
その高起動を制御出来ずによく自爆してしまうところもある種のお約束。

あとこのゲームはBGMがすごく良い。
おかげで一人でやっていてもすごい盛り上がる。
特に隠しステージのAscensionは難易度演出ともに最高峰。

一応このゲームの売りはローカル対戦モードらしいが、このように一人でも十分遊べているのでオススメ。

絶賛ばかりするのもあれなので、あえて気に入らなかった点を挙げるとすれば、良くも悪くもキャラに個性がないところか。
このゲームで選択できるキャラクターはデフォ4＋隠し4の計8キャラだが、その性能は全部一緒。
要するに対戦ゲームにおけるキャラ差が一切ないということだが、個人的にはちょっとした性能差があっても良かったんじゃないかなと思う。

18538019.review:
"Летящая стрела покоится в полете"

Игра лично для меня определенно не однозначная, выходец с не самой удачной консоли Ouya, но на видео при этом выглядящяя достаточно бодро и весело. Купить эту игру я хотел еще при старте продаж в стиме, но с той поры уже кардинально успел поменять свое мнение. Одна стрела - один труп, такова логика игры сразу же вспоминается достаточно азартная Bushido Blade, но есть слишком много НО.
 
Мультиплеер выглядит очень бодро и если у вас есть друг (или даже много друзей) который готов потратить с вами время за парой партий в этой игре, то почему бы и нет? Игра очень скудна на графику, может быть в каком нибудь рогалике это и не сильно бросается в глаза благодаря большому количеству разнообразия, но тут то и возникает главная проблема. 

В игре ну очень мало разнообразия - у героев по три стрелы (вы серьезно? у лучника 3 стрелы?), персонажи ничем не отличаются друг от друга, переход от неплохо нарисованного рисунка к мало-битной модельке уж слишком пугает, нету разнообразия анимаций/стрел/персонажей/мало уровней компании/уровни невероятно маленькие (где логика при игре с луками)/скиллов тоже мало, а при просмотре DLC для данной игры задаешься вопросом это что вырваный кусок из игры?... 

Вообщем я вас предупредил... сыграете вы не долго и то скорее всего вместе с друзьями, денег которые я на нее потратил она определенно не стоит. (а для версий на консоли и подавно) Так же в игре есть фича благодаря которой вы можете даже сами того не понимая потерять все стрелы, либо наоборот получить без какой либо внутреигровой логики.

18472774.review:
Una pantalla son 4 lados o 4 esquinas, un cuadrado o un rombo también tiene cuatro lados y son 4 esquinas. Tower fall Ascension tambien es un juego de 4 lados bajo una superficie rectangular.

_Diversión, matemática_
.........Equilibrio............
_Frenesí, cooperación_

Realmente este juego es una joya aunque no se entiende porqué solo lo han dedicado al local. Si hago un esfuerzo por entenderlo diria que de esta forma los creadores protegen al juego de ''amenazas externas''. Billones de veces sa hará dicho ya ''amenaza externa''. no creo que esté diciendo ninguna tonteria. Jugar en local o en el mismo  PC varios jugadores también es algo muy hermoso.

Lo mejor del juego sin embargo es su desafio, que nos saca parcialmente de los parámetros tradicionales para jugar con otras ideas que se utilizaban en los 80, y que gracias a la tecnologia esta jugabilidad ha sido multiplicada. Si hablo de una multiplicacion es porque dicha multiplicacion es equilibrada, si no es así, no hablaria.

Cosas como su fluidez, su control, sus reglas y su apartado ártistico condicionan a este juego de sobresaliente, me ha dado una buena lección. Si las imágenes te dicen algo es imprescindible tenerlo en ''deseados''.

18416398.review:
The best local multiplayer game I have played since Super Smash Bros Melee and Mario Kart. In this 16-bit battle game you are spawned in a small arena and fight enemies by shooting them with arrows, or jumping on their heads, Mario style.

Pros:
+Excellent co-op mode
+Excellent versus mode
+Fun 16-bit graphics
+Nice sound track
+There are loads of customizable options for versus mode
+Lots of co-op levels with two difficulties each
+Linux port

Mixed
+/-Controllers are recommended

Cons:
-No online multiplayer

The keyboard controls are fine for this game, but since you are hopefully going to have at least two people sitting at the same desk, controllers are recommended (unless you want a keyboard in your lap, that is). The lack of online multiplayer is almost an improvement to this game, since it actually forces people to sit in the same room together. Reminds me of the good old days of N64 and PS2/Gamecube.

The bottom line is, if you don't have friends living nearby and you don't have at least one controller, you probably shouldn't buy this game. But if you have those things, this game is a blast.

18351343.review:
I can't recommend this game enough. At first, I thought of it as just another silly game trying to cash in on the retro 8-bit style but once I actually played it I realized it is much more than that. This game has a lot going for it. It is mainly a 4-player local versus mode but also has 2-player co-op quest mode. If you can get 3 friends to come over and play this you will have a blast. Think of it as a retro style "Goldeneye" of this time. You get plenty of content for what you are paying for. Many maps, modes, weapons and characters to choose from.  The character designs are unique and likeable. Many clever unlockables such as characters and stages. The music is fantastic and memorable, I occasionally get the random songs stuck in my head. The difficulty for quest mode scales nicely throughout the game. You also get a nice time trial mode that will teach you how to get better at the game quick. Great replay value as well. 

There's so many good things to say and I haven't even tried the expansion yet!

18172394.review:
Simple game with pixelated graphics (pixels are not my cup of tea, usually, I've left them behind since 1990 or so... But then, this game is not about graphics).

We already had lots of fun with this one in the little time we played it. The local coop mode is good. This is a fast unforgiving game playable in small bites (another retry is only a few minutes more, and the success is very satisfying).  

The local "versus mode" is even better. You need to make split second decisions, and at some point, you're guaranteed to make some hilarious blunder and find yourself pinned to the wall with all your opponent's arrows through your body. But then, you can take your revenge during the next round.

Recommended for big fun in small bites, especially if you've got two controllers and two players on a regular basis...

18165976.review:
Really good local multiplayer title. Better with 3+ players I find but it's a really exciting game where you'll curse and cheer as everyone in the room exchanges fire from varying types of arrows and get to watch it unfold in a replay ..which you can export in gif formant ...and rub in their face later. SUCK IT NERDS. 

A variety of characters that don't have any different traits but instead contrast with eachother so you won't lose who you are easily. 
There's a good amount of levels with different hazards and a different ammo for your bows as well as mutators ....or match options I guess they'd be better known as. Arrows can be more or less homing, have random arrows, low gravity, all sorts of fun tweaks to make the matches new and insane. 

Worth the money if you got friends to play with locally, otherwise? It doesn't really have single player appeal, that is more of a bonus and NOT a reason to grab the game. The co-op is fun, it spawns monsters that you and a friend have to kill as they enter before moving to the next stage. ...which is more or less the single player.

18160110.review:
Ce jeu est sans doute le MEILLEUR jeu multijoueur qui ait été créé. De 2 à 4 joueurs, le plaisir derrière la manette est énorme. Nerveux et dynamique, on recommence rapidement une partie avec ses potes et on s'améliore à chacune d'entre elles, au point de faire à un moment naturellement les bons mouvements, les esquives et les tirs parfaits. Chaque partie avec ses amis n'est que de la rigolade, tellement l'improbable puisse se produire. Le mode solo est passable, et sera juste là pour débloquer les personnages et niveaux bonus, rien de plus. Même si à deux, il peut être amusant de faire les quêtes, on préférera le mode versus, plus intéressant. Pour le reste, le jeu est énorme, les graphismes simples et pixelisés lui donnent un cachet et la bande son est magnifique. Le DLC ajoute encore un nouveau personnage, un skin alternatif pour les 9 perso, de nouveaux niveaux, des boss, de nouvelles flèches, etc. Bref, avec ou sans ce dernier, le jeu est sublime, un bijou à avoir absoluement pour les soirées entre potes.

Note : 9/10
Les plus : beaucoup de rigolade en multijoueur, les différentes flèches qui changent complètement les parties et la bande-son sublime.

Es gibt zwei Schwierigkeisstufen, Normal und Hardcore. Um ein Level mit goldenen Schädel abzuschließen, muss man das Level auf Hardcore spielen und darf kein Leben verlieren.

18154143.review:
Do you have a moment to talk about our lord and savior TowerFall Ascension?

I guess you've already heard the words "easy to pick hard to master"? What would you say if I add "coop and versus couch party" and "4 playable characters and more than 10 levels to unlock in.. unique ways"?

That's what I tought.

TowerFall Ascencion is a simple platformer. Move, jump, shoot and dodge. You can also crouch if you are fancy. It is fast paced and it will go faster as you become better.

The multiplayer is a simple deathmatch or a team deathmatch. There is a lot of options to customize the gameplay and make it more competitive or more crazy. The single player is a serie of quests. The goal of those is to defeat waves of ennemies on a map. The ennemies are defined by the level and they have unique features. The levels have increasing difficulty and they all have a hardcore mode, if you tought you were getting good.

There is also a DLC which I also recommend. It adds 4 missions playable with 4 coop players, 10 characters, 4 new multiplier maps, one of which is procedurally generated, 2 new types of arrows and the map editor.

17731162.review:
TowerFall Ascension is an arena type game. This game was released in March 2014, after initially being released as an Ouya exclusive in 2013 (snarf). It is now on PC, PS4 and Mac/Linux.

TowerFall's arena type gameplay focuses heavily on archery. The game has two modes; firstly the single player - the aim is to kill targets around each stage either by stomping on their heads, or by shooting them with your bow before a timer runs out; this leaves to plenty of replaying of levels in order to better your score and to beat your best time. 

Where TowerFall really shines is in the multiplayer mode. Up to four players will fight in a battle royal environment. Your aim is simple, kill or be killed. Each player has a limited amount of arrows to do it in too, so you can't just spam fire and hope you get lucky. You are able to replenish your ammo by picking up rogue arrows shot by yourself and the others though, meaning things can get very frantic. Throughout the stage, there will also be various different power-ups spawn, such as special effects on your arrows or shields - these all add to the extremely fast paced gameplay. 

The graphics and art style, yet again have the pixelated theme, but they are still all really well drawn out and it looks very pleasant. Each of the arenas that you are fighting in also look amazing too, some will be set in the jungle, others in a poorly lit cave, they all look gorgeous. 

Single player in TowerFall Ascension is easy; you can easily clear the stages in less than an hour. Where the difficulty ramps up like most games is the multiplayer. It will only be as difficult as your opponents are, as they are they only thing that can kill you; you don't need to worry about the environment playing tricks against you.  It will take you a few hours to get to a point where you are competent in games; it can be very frustrating though. 

I have been playing TowerFall for almost eight hours now; I would say that this is a game to play in small chunks. Bring it out when you have friends over for an hour of almost archery style Super Smash Bro fun, but any more than that, and you may find yourself getting a little bored.  This is certainly a game to keep installed due to the replay-ability though. 

The game supports resolutions up to 1080P, which I suppose is all you need for a pixel style game like this and it is highly recommended you play this game with a game pad; keyboard controls would be a nightmare. 

To conclude, I am going to simply recommend TowerFall Ascension; its a game that not everyone will enjoy, and is almost certainly made with couch multiplayer in mind. If you don't have friends who also own this game, don't get it, the single player is not worth it. If you can find a group to play with, sure its worth the £10,99 because of the fun fast paced gameplay you'll get out of it. 


[b][u] Tom's Score Card[/u][/b]
1) Stay away
2) Only recommended when on sale
[b][u]3) Recommended[/u][/b]
4) Highly recommended
5) This is a must play

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

http://store.steampowered.com/app/251470

17680950.review: One of my favorite games on Steam, if not one of my all-time favorites, if not my all-time favorite. It's just good fun. The controls are tight and responsive, the mechanics are the perfect blend of "easy to learn, hard to master." Multiplayer is the most fun you can have outside of Smash (and if you ask me it's just the most fun, period), though as part of the "couch multiplayer" revival it features no online mode, so bear that in mind. The art design is spectacular, and just goes to show that pixel art is not only alive and well but more vibrant and beautiful than ever. The score is a mix of crunchy, punchy chiptunes and eclectic orchestral/folk sounds, giving each stage a one-of-a-kind atmosphere. Between the timed Trials and 1-2 player Quest mode, several difficulty levels and insane challenges, crafty unlockable characters, and the aforementioned barrel of fun that is the multiplayer, there's plenty of content to keep you busy; and the latest Dark World expansion only multiplies the replay value. Simply put, this game is firing on all cylinders. Can't recommend it enough, do yourself the favor and play it.

17251803.review:
Towerfall Ascension é um jogo complicado de explicar. Primeiramente tenha em mente que você não vai ter muito lucro com ele sem controles ( não necessariamente, mas preferencialmente de XBOX ) e o mais importante, amigos. O jogo tem um modo single player chamado " Quest " que pode ser jogado apenas com um jogador e inclusive com o teclado, mas ele não tem muito a oferecer.

A verdadeira diversão do jogo está no massivo modo multiplayer local, apresentando até 4 slots de jogadores numa mesma arena. Você pode escolher entre diversos arqueiros ( apesar de apenas o visual deles mudar ) em várias arenas únicas com flechas especiais diversificadas.

O gráfico do jogo não é ruim, como muitos dizem. É retrô, faz uma menção à era dos 16-32 bits.

Aliás, as mecânicas e fatores visuais do jogo interferem bastante na sua jogatina. Por exemplo, quando a flecha passa de raspão por sua cabeça, você perde seu acessório ( touca, chapéu, cachecol ); Quando sua flecha passa por uma torcha ela pega fogo, etc.

É um jogo incrível pois permite que qualquer um o jogue sem muitas dificuldades, já que apresenta controles bem simples. Entretanto, só os veteranos sabem o quão insanas as partidas podem ser.

16701923.review:
[h1]Divertido, Inavador, Incrível! [/h1]

É incrível como uma mecânica que foi inventada a décadas atrás, ainda pode surpreender e envolver jogadores de todas as idades. Os mais velhos lembrarão do Mario do Arcade. Simples, mas muito divertido. 
Towerfall não é diferente, ele pegou esses elementos e inovaram ainda mais!

[b] Como funciona? [/b]
Bom, o objetivo do jogo é simples. Eliminar o seu adversário. Pode ser jogado em até 4 pessoas, podendo ser em equipes ou todo mundo contra (Deathmach).
O jogo oferece também uma opção de singleplayer onde você tem que derrotar os inimigos em todas ondas (Waves) que tiver. A cada onda fica mais difícil. 
Mas o brilho maior do jogo fica por conta do multiplayer mesmo. 

[B] Gameplay [/b]
A jogabilidade é incrivel, responde com precisão. 
Cada jogador possui um numero limite de flechas, que ao atiradas, precisam ser pegas de volta para poder atirar, se não, você só poderar eliminar seu oponente pulando (Mario?) em cima dele.
A variedade de flechas e upgrades é incrível. Você pode pegar asas, andar mais rápido, ter um escudo, flechas que varam a parede, ricochoteam... 
O fator replay é incrível! 

[b] Conclusão [/b]
Jogo excelente para ser jogado multiplayer. No coop das "Waves" o único problema é que se um player morrer muito, ele irá usar as vidas do outro player pra reviver. 
Jogo perfeito para uma diversão garantida!

[B] Análise feita ao som de: [/b]
[i]Fez: Adventure - Rich Vreeland, Andrew Skeet
